bug.author: Balandat
bug.summary: batch mode torch.cholesky does not raise RuntimeError on GPU if not pos. def.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When trying to perform batch Cholesky decomposition of a singular matrix on the GPU, a tensor with NaNs is returned instead of raising a RuntimeError as on the CPU. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>torch.cholesky(torch.ones(2, 2)) # -> RuntimeError
torch.cholesky(torch.ones(1, 2, 2)) # -> RuntimeError
torch.cholesky(torch.ones(2, 2, device="cuda")) # -> RuntimeError
torch.cholesky(torch.ones(1, 2, 2, device="cuda")) # -> tensor([[[1., 0.], [1., nan]]], device='cuda:0') </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Behavior should be consistent between CPU and GPU, i.e., a RuntimeError should be raised in the last call above. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
This is on master (fbcode).

comments.comment: I will take a look at this. Thank you for reporting.

This seems to be a MAGMA issue. I've opened a discussion on the MAGMA forums <denchmark-link:https://icl.cs.utk.edu/magma/forum/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=2361&sid=d93add864c3744927d3a979423789bf7>here</denchmark-link> . There was a very similar issue with getrf (the driver for LU decomposition) which was fixed in MAGMA v2.5.0.
I have got the issued fixed by the MAGMA team. The fix should be available in their recent release: v2.5.1-alpha1. cc: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/soumith>@soumith</denchmark-link>

Can we update to this new release soon? This kind of annoying to have to work around, I currently do the following: <denchmark-code>L = torch.cholesky(A, upper=upper, out=out) # TODO: Remove once fixed in pytorch (#16780) if A.dim() > 2 and A.is_cuda: if torch.isnan(L if out is None else out).any(): raise RuntimeError </denchmark-code>
cc: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/soumith>@soumith</denchmark-link> is this a good time to release the 2.5.1alpha binaries for MAGMA?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Balandat>@Balandat</denchmark-link> , the latest MAGMA binaries are available on Anaconda, thanks to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/soumith>@soumith</denchmark-link> . The fix to this issue is available in this binary, and hence marking this issue as resolved. Please re-open if you think this is not the case.
